channel.title: Building a pc
channel.description:
[quote="Newty, post:15, topic:385664"]http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/pc-gaming-overclock-build-a-pc,3443.html
Looking like I'm going to be building this. I've been reading up on it and everyone seems to think it needs a better video card. Does anyone have a suggestion on a better video card?[/quote]
Input please, my budget is roughly 600 usd but it can go up to 800 or so.
EDIT: Pics of the new rig!
http://imgur.com/a/RiTTE

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Cruel Truth, post:46, topic:516367”][quote author=Newty link=topic=634626.msg4286535#msg4286535 date=1366418879]
http://s21.postimg.org/mog08efqf/new_ratings.png

After cloning my old install of windows from my HDD to my SSD and wiping the old drive.

I’ve enabled TRIM, disabled indexing, disabled sysrestore, disabled defragging and ensured that the SSD is alligned properly. Is there anything else I need to do as far as optimization goes?

Also, to my shagrin I discovered my mobo doesn’t have SATA3 capibilities. Still getting amazing read/write times though compared to my HDD
[/quote]with that setup and only 7.5? 0_0 how the hell do people get 9.0’s[/quote]

The rating only goes to 7.9

Also your base score is determined by your lowest subscore because your lowest score is a bottleneck.

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

After cloning my old install of windows from my HDD to my SSD and wiping the old drive.

I’ve enabled TRIM, disabled indexing, disabled sysrestore, disabled defragging and ensured that the SSD is alligned properly. Is there anything else I need to do as far as optimization goes?

Also, to my shagrin I discovered my mobo doesn’t have SATA3 capibilities. Still getting amazing read/write times though compared to my HDD

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

Couple of things after reading the first three pages…

@tyb the socket you posted is a 1155 , which is really outdated - ish but still decent, should go for one that is 2011. The speed also was only 6mb…which is pretty good but if you want “decent fast” then you should have at least 8mb.

@the person who was talking about eight cores…please keep in mind most stuff work with six cores and will be more compatible or whatever you want to call it. Eight core isn’t really “new” but it hasn’t been designed for specifically much yet either

@amd vs intel?

Well if you want to get technical amd is probably your best bet for a “good gaming rig with decent prices” if your a hardcore gamer who wants the best of the best though… " pay the price for the best "

Personally…I would had put an extra 150-200$ into it to get the extra features I just posted above.

They cost a little more but if your going to buy a pre-built one from newegg…one of these would be more realistic. keep in mind both of these I still suggest getting a higher power supply though!

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883258016

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229386

edit:

Not entirely sure what type of chipsets are good for AMD so feel free to correct me on these

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883258021

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883258022R

Read full topic

item.title: Building a pc
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:36, topic:516367”][quote author=Newty link=topic=634626.msg4285262#msg4285262 date=1366249628]

Newty that build mitb posted for you on the original thread 2 years ago, I built that. I have the exact same windows rating as you (including all ratings)

ps did that computer come with that mouse and keyboard in the photo? that looks like a RAT 7 dude and they’re like $150 stock

What did you pay for it?

Yeah, the mouse and keyboard pictured came with it. They look just like the rat7 but they appear to be ibuypower proprietary. They look almost identical though and they look and feel pretty awesome. I took some pictures on my wifes iPhone, waiting for them to finish uploading/appear in my inbox.
[/quote]
Damn that’s pretty good lol, my mouse of preference is my SteelSeries Sensei though (I own a RAT and a Razer Naga, aswell, but I much prefer my Sensei)

I think in total I paid about $700?[/quote]

Roughly what I paid after shipping and taxes were all said and done. It was 600 before all that bullshit though…

Sorry for the poor quality…

[Album] New Desktop

Read full topic
